title: Define message tier matrix
description: The connected mobility solution must classify messages from the vehicle fleet to the cloud backend in at least two tiers: high priority messages and low priority messages. The tier structure is multidimensional to account for urgency and relevance dimensions.
outcome: Message prioritization framework enabling differential handling based on urgency and relevance

title_full: CMOBREL01-BP02 Have a strategy for critical functions
title: Have a strategy for critical functions
description: Implement critical functions such as emergency calls where messages must be delivered no matter what. Plan for redundancy for every physical or logical component of in-vehicle and communication layers. Consider building the control plane in multiple Regions for critical functions.
outcome: Highly available critical functions with multi-region redundancy

title: Guardrail chatty vehicles
description: The connected mobility control plane must tolerate anomalies in message workflows from vehicles, throttling low priority messages to avoid exceeding service quotas and unwanted cost spikes. Implement a multi-tier message classification with throttling policies.
outcome: Protected service quotas through intelligent message throttling

title_full: CMOBREL02-BP02 Avoid connection surge to the cloud
title: Avoid connection surge to the cloud
description: Vehicle-side applications and firmware must implement randomized connections to backend cloud applications to avoid peak traffic. Traffic from low priority messages should be randomized. The same randomized behavior must be implemented on the cloud backend for messages sent to vehicles.
outcome: Smoothed traffic patterns avoiding connection surges through randomization

title_full: CMOBREL03-BP01 Implement just-in-time provisioning and registration
title: Implement just-in-time provisioning and registration
description: When using AWS IoT Core, implement just-in-time provisioning (JITP), just-in-time registration (JITR), or both. Certificates are provisioned the first time devices connect using a certificate template or Lambda function, which can help restore a compromised device registry.
outcome: Resilient device registry with automated certificate provisioning

title_full: CMOBREL03-BP02 Manual backup of the device registry
title: Manual backup of the device registry
description: AWS IoT Core stores device registry data, CA certificates, device certificates, and shadow data with automatic cross-AZ replication. Use AWS IoT Core MQTT events when registry is updated to back up registry data to a DynamoDB table or other storage.
outcome: Protected device registry with manual backup capabilities

title: Implement a layered approach
description: Adopt a layered approach to mitigate unintended access. Create physical network layers (engine control unit layer, in-vehicle communication network layer, external interfaces layer) using gateways, firewalls, message authentication, encryption, and intrusion detection. Develop OTA update capabilities, conduct risk assessment and attack testing, and create domain separation for in-vehicle networks.
outcome: Defense in depth through layered security and network isolation

title_full: CMOBREL05-BP01 Account for telco provider outages
title: Account for telco provider outages
description: The connected mobility solution must account for failures in the telco transport layer. The solution must be able to distinguish if a connection drop was caused by the vehicle, the telco, or the control plane in the cloud.
outcome: Resilient to telco outages with proper failure attribution

title: Implement in-vehicle functionalities
description: Vehicles must be able to operate without internet connectivity. Implement robust operations in vehicle firmware and software to provide basic capabilities. Store important messages durably offline and send them once reconnected. Implement exponential retry and back-off logic when connection attempts fail.
outcome: Vehicle autonomy with offline capabilities and message queuing

title: Monitor what matters
description: Implement a Vehicle Network Operations Center (V-NOC) with observability of vehicle systems, backend systems, and user-facing applications. Monitor all components including vehicle-based units. Enable observability on integrations for troubleshooting, failure analysis, and performance profiling. Use CloudWatch, X-Ray, managed Prometheus, and Grafana.
outcome: Comprehensive end-to-end observability across all connected mobility components

title_full: CMOBREL07-BP01 Log interpretation and context propagation
title: Log interpretation and context propagation
description: Collect logs into a centralized store with filtering, transformation, and enrichment capabilities. Use CloudWatch Logs for centralization with live-tail, search, and filtering. Secure logs with encryption at rest, auditing, and masking of sensitive data for compliance.
outcome: Centralized log management with enrichment and security controls

title: Define and calculate metrics (Aggregation)
description: Define metrics linked to business outcomes. Create metric filters to match terms in log events and convert to metrics. Assign units and dimensions to metrics. Implement aggregations to determine severity of impact.
outcome: Business-aligned metrics with proper aggregation and dimensionality

title_full: CMOBREL09-BP01 Real-time processing and alarming with notifications and automated response
title: Real-time processing and alarming with notifications and automated response
description: Integrate Vehicle-NOC with existing processes and tools for alarming and trouble tracking. Use intelligent systems to reduce noise by finding patterns across issues. Enable anomaly detection to determine normal baselines and surface anomalies. Send alerts to Amazon SNS for distribution.
outcome: Intelligent real-time alerting with pattern recognition and automated response

title_full: CMOBREL12-BP01 Identify and back up all data that needs to be backed up, or reproduce the data from sources
title: Identify and back up all data that needs to be backed up, or reproduce the data from sources
description: Classify data entities and determine criticality to make strategic decisions for data recovery based on RPO - either backing up or reproducing data. Classification helps determine retention periods driving cost optimization.
outcome: Classified data with appropriate backup or reproduction strategies

title: Perform data backup automatically
description: Use AWS Backup and AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery for automated backups with RPO in seconds. Use AWS Storage Gateway or AWS DataSync for hybrid infrastructure setups.
outcome: Automated backup processes with low RPO for critical data

title: Secure and encrypt backups
description: Safeguard backups with proper permissions to prevent tampering. Encrypt backups to protect against accidental leaks. Use IAM roles and policies with least privileged access. Follow best practices for S3 data lakes. Use legal hold feature to prevent accidental deletions.
outcome: Secured and encrypted backups protected from unauthorized access and deletion

title_full: CMOBREL12-BP04 Perform periodic recovery of the data to verify backup integrity and processes
title: Perform periodic recovery of the data to verify backup integrity and processes
description: Validate backups through recovery testing to ensure they meet RTO and RPO. Repeat testing periodically using well-defined mechanisms. Use PITR features in RDS and DynamoDB, and continual snapshots with AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery.
outcome: Validated backup and recovery processes meeting RTO/RPO requirements

title_full: CMOBREL13-BP01 Deploy the workload to multiple locations
title: Deploy the workload to multiple locations
description: Deploy services across multiple locations with redundant, decoupled components. Use Multi-AZ solutions for most use cases. Apply multi-region selectively for DR. Use AWS Local Zones for low-latency requirements. Implement edge computing with CloudFront, Global Accelerator, API Gateway, and Lambda@Edge. Consider AWS Outposts for on-premises requirements.
outcome: Highly available deployment across multiple AZs, regions, and edge locations
